abstract: Study published by Dr William E Pelham and Dr Susan Murphy in Journal of Clinical Child & Adolescent Psychology finds children with attention-deficit disorder improve more quickly when given behavioral therapy first, rather than starting immediately on medication.
lead_paragraph: Experts said this approach could possibly change standard medical practice, which favors drugs like Adderall and Ritalin as first-line treatments.

headline.main: Early Behavior Therapy Found to Aid Children With A.D.H.D.
headline.print_headline: Behavior Therapy Found to Be Better First Step Than Medicine to Treat A.D.H.D.

snippet: Experts said this approach could possibly change standard medical practice, which favors drugs like Adderall and Ritalin as first-line treatments.

keywords.value: Journal of Clinical Child & Adolescent Psychology
keywords.name: organizations
